meanings.definition: Extending back beyond memory, record, or knowledge.
meanings.sent1: The ancient ruins stood as a reminder of immemorial civilizations.
meanings.sent2: The village had an immemorial charm that captivated all who visited.
meanings.sent3: The immemorial tree in the backyard seemed to have witnessed all of our family's secrets.
meanings.sent4: The immemorial mountains loomed in the distance, their peaks shrouded in mist.
meanings.sent5: The immemorial tales passed down through generations painted a vivid picture of the past.

meanings.sent1: The immemorial artifacts found in the tomb amazed archaeologists.
meanings.sent2: Legends spoke of an immemorial sword that could only be wielded by the chosen one.
meanings.sent3: The immemorial castle on the hill was rumored to be haunted by friendly ghosts.
meanings.sent4: The immemorial oak tree in the town square was a symbol of strength and resilience.
meanings.sent5: The immemorial traditions of the festival brought the community together in celebration.

meanings.definition: Time out of mind; time beyond memory.
meanings.sent1: The immemorial customs of the tribe were passed down through storytelling.
meanings.sent2: The ruins of the immemorial city hinted at a glorious past now forgotten.
meanings.sent3: The immemorial clock in the town square always seemed to run a bit too slow.
meanings.sent4: The immemorial stars in the night sky whispered tales of the universe's birth.
meanings.sent5: The immemorial bond between the siblings was unbreakable, forged in childhood adventures.
